sections.purpose: To dry and store moisture-sensitive samples in a low-humidity environment.
sections.scope: Applicable to drying plant powders, ash residues, and weighed samples in Pharmacognosy.
procedure: Place an appropriate desiccant (e.g., silica gel) in the lower compartment of the desiccator.
Arrange samples in crucibles or containers on the perforated plate without overlapping.
Apply a thin film of vacuum grease to the desiccator lid if using a vacuum desiccator.
Close the lid securely and, if applicable, connect to a vacuum pump and evacuate gently.
Allow samples to cool or dry to constant weight as required by the procedure.
Release vacuum slowly (if used) before opening and removing samples.
precautions: Do not place hot samples directly into a vacuum desiccator; allow slight cooling first.
Handle glass desiccators carefully to avoid breakage or implosion.
Regenerate or replace desiccant when color indicators show saturation.
Avoid scratching the ground-glass joint surfaces.
Do not tilt or carry the desiccator by the lid.
